Key Arguments: The bill contradicts the principles of a democratic society.
Australia has historically prospered through free thinking and open debate.
The bill could lead to a totalitarian state where government decree overrides the will of the people.
The bill is seen as a betrayal of democratic values fought for by previous generations.
Main Themes: Fear of government overreach and totalitarianism
Notable Quotes: We should be a free thinking, open minded and creative society - which we have been.
This bill will ensure Australia becomes a totalitarian state and the will of its people becomes submerged by government decree.
Our forefathers fought hard for our democracy & we should not give it up if the nation is to continue to prosper.
